That's a great idea.  I can't wait till you have those fansites up. 
I know a few people who buy manga just -because-, and it doesn't 
even matter if they can't read them since they are fans (myself 
included). A place where we can at least read a summary per chapter 
or volume is great than having nothing at all (except beautiful 
images *snicker*). Let me know if I can help you in anyway and 
goodluck!

~Kizu

p.s. Niwashi my apologies for not getting your name right.. *kicks 
self*. I shouldn't really respond when I'm running out the door. ^^;;


 --- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Niwashi" <labaker@s...> wrote:
> Kizu wrote:
> > aside from the beautiful artwork I cannot make a lot of
> > sense to it by just trying to figure out what's happening through
> > the images.
> 
> I'm thinking of setting up a fan site for some of these.  While 
full
> translations seem a bit too daunting, I might put up detailed 
chapter by
> chapter (or story by story in the case of Okita-Kirameki no 
Zanzou) plot
> descriptions along with a "who's who" gallery with images of each
> significant character.  Perhaps after reading a full summary, the 
books'
> images would make more sense.  It would take me a while to get 
something set
> up, but then I'll probably start with Getsu Mei Sei Ki and some of 
the
> stories from Okita Souji - Kirameki no Zanzou, to be followed by 
Hokusou
> Shinsengumi and later Burai and perhaps some of the others.  I'll 
post a
> link once I have something to point it to.
> 
> Niwashi
> 
> p.s.  I just ordered Shinsengumi Hijikata Toshizou Mibu no Ginrou 
(the
> companion volume to Shinsengumi Okita Souji Kirameki no Zanzou), 
the next
> couple volumes of Getsu Mei Sei Ki, and the first volume of 
Onikami Shinsen.
> With ground shipping from halfway around the world, I won't get 
them for a
> month or so, but eventually I'll have a few more reviews to add.
